Expectation1: Perform maintenance and cleaning of the machines to ensure optimal performance
Situation1: A critical bearing is screeching loudly and threatening an immediate breakdown.
Situation2: A significant community milestone is being marked, and attendees have travelled specifically to hear the imam's sermon.
Story:
The shrill screech of the bearing echoed through the factory, drowning out even my own thoughts. I wiped the sweat from my brow, hands blackened with grease, as I stared at the trembling machine. If I didn’t act now, the whole line could grind to a halt—production would stop, and the workers would be sent home. My supervisor’s words from this morning rang in my ears: “We can’t afford downtime today. You’re the only one who can fix it.”

But my phone buzzed with reminders from the mosque committee. Today was not just any Friday—it was the day our community celebrated the completion of the new prayer hall. Families had come from neighboring towns, and the congregation was waiting for me, their imam, to deliver the sermon that would mark this milestone. I could picture the expectant faces, the children in their best clothes, the elders who had contributed so much.

My heart pounded as I stood between the shrieking machine and the call to prayer, torn by the weight of two worlds, each demanding all of me at the same moment.
